intro: Hemiboea glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular hemiboea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, glandular hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
